episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of fascinating topics, including the unique relationship between lobsters and jellyfish, the construction of an impractical telescope in France, the origins of America's first gentleman's club centered around turtle soup, and the surprising use of a stunt double by daredevil Evel Knievel in a film.

facts.fact: Smooth fan lobsters travel around the sea inside jellyfish, eating their rides as they go.
In 1892, France built a telescope which was so long it couldn't actually be pointed at the sky.
The first gentleman's club in America was formed for the purpose of eating turtle soup.
When Evel Knievel starred in the 1977 film "Viva Knievel," he used a stunt double.
